intro: Tabernaemontana alfaroi, commonly known as the Alfaroi star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink blossoms. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
